Upland.Rancho Cucamonga:
This article refers to the land grant. For the city of Rancho Cucamonga, see Rancho Cucamonga, California
Rancho Cucamonga was a 13,045-acre (52.79 km2) Mexican land grant in present-day San Bernardino County, California given in 1839 to dedicated soldier, smuggler and politician, Tiburcio Tapia by Mexican governor Juan Bautista Alvarado. The grant encompassed present-day Rancho Cucamonga.
